body_html:
The underlying issue is that bazel test //tensorflow/... will try to build all rules, including the new ones introduced in //tensorflow/contrib/verbs.

The right fix is to wrap code that requires external verb headers in a #define (look around the code for #ifdef GOOGLE_CUDA for an example) and set that define if the rdma config is set.

A simple way to test if your code works is to run: bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/verbs/...
body_text:
The underlying issue is that bazel test //tensorflow/... will try to build all rules, including the new ones introduced in //tensorflow/contrib/verbs.
The right fix is to wrap code that requires external verb headers in a #define (look around the code for #ifdef GOOGLE_CUDA for an example) and set that define if the rdma config is set.
A simple way to test if your code works is to run: bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/verbs/...
body:
The underlying issue is that `bazel test //tensorflow/...` will try to build all rules, including the new ones introduced in //tensorflow/contrib/verbs.

The right fix is to wrap code that requires external verb headers in a #define (look around the code for #ifdef GOOGLE_CUDA for an example) and set that define if the rdma config is set.

A simple way to test if your code works is to run: `bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/verbs/...`
